Posts.Content: Sep 27, 2009 10:03AM kk69Z wrote: I didn't find mine through self exams. As a matter of fact I was at my radiologist last week (last appt. to see her -goodie!) and she asked if I do self breast exams. I told her I probably wouldn't know what a lump feels like. Mine are dense and there is so many little bumps in mine. And when I told her they are dense, she said I probably would never feel it. Nice to hear. I wonder what a non-dense breast feels like. Anyone else with the dense problem?

Posts.Title: Where is everyone from? shelbyjane72 BarbaraA

Posts.Content: May 8, 2010 04:54PM kk69Z wrote: HI MHP, I know when I was diagnosed two years ago, I didn't know a thing about breast cancer or any other kind. It wasn't until 5 months later did I find this site. I also had a lumpectomy (actually 2 for clean margins). I knew that cancer could spread to the lymph nodes, but I didn't know about auxillery and sentinal nodes. When I went into surgery I really wasn't even thinking about that. I was a stage 1. All I remember was the nurse telling me after I was out of surgery and wasn't even fully awake that they took out 3 sentinal nodes and it didn't go to any sentinal or auxillery nodes. I was very relieved to here that. I know you are thinking.  You will worry yourself to death until your surgery. Think positive and even if it did there are treatments and alot of support on this board. So many great women here. Very kind and supportive. Good luck
Posts.Title: Waiting for Lumpectomy, MRI looks good LtotheK Valjean

Posts.Content: May 13, 2010 02:38PM kk69Z wrote: My theory to this radiation is: if you want it get it or if you don't don't. I had 2 lumpetomies, got clear margins, had radiation and am on tamoxifen. I figured I was darn lucky the first time it being caught early and non-aggresive. I was going to do everything I possibly could to keep it away. If I have to stay on these pills the rest of my life (I'm 53) I will. The decision is your's to do what you want to do. I didn't want to say later on, I wish I would have .......... Good Luck on whatever you girls do and I wish you the best.
Posts.Title: Why do I need radiation? June2268 o2bhealthy

Posts.Content: Jul 26, 2009 06:55PM kk69Z wrote: Joan, Hi I also had a partial about 10 years ago. I had a cyst removed abdominally. Everything went all but for my ovaries. Everyone (including doctor) told me I would be in the hospital a week. I had my surgery late afternoon on a Wed and was out Saturday AM. Was in the hospital before and I made up my mind I was not staying the weekend. They are so boring. Once I got home, recovery was about 6 weeks. It was hard trying to get out of bed, but after a few days I had that mastered. Just have to push up with arm behind your back. I didn't miss them taking anything. I was just glad no more periods. I had enough of them. Good luck

Posts.Content: Sep 25, 2009 05:47PM kk69Z wrote: I had two MRI's. I wasn't wild about it, but I survived. Mine was closed, but the very end was open and as long as I could see out I was o.k.
